page.title: 06MR.WHEELER -CONTINUED.
page.content: The pole itself always comes from a valley where it grows tall and straight to reach the sun.It is made of larch which is strong and should last 20 to 30 years. Mr Wheeler finds the right diameter by putting his arms around the tree. The pole used to be carried by hay wain from the green in front of the Crown Inn where it was painted,to the village green. Here it would be erected by hand using three sets of pulleys attatched to house's nearby. It was placed six feet into the ground, the vertical line being taken from the corner of a row of cottages. Nowadays a crane is used. This year it was weighed and, at a height of 84 feet and one and a half tons, it is the tallest free standing maypole in the country.
